abstract: A collection of analysis-ready Multilevel Monitoring System (MLMS) datasets for wells in the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) aquifer-monitoring network, Idaho National Laboratory (INL), Idaho. Administered by the USGS INL Project Office in cooperation with the U.S. Department of Energy.
purpose: The consolidation of this data into a single release significantly streamlines the data processing tasks for researchers. It offers a convenient method to disseminate the data along with its associated documentation in a standardized format. The geospatial datasets are presented in a universally recognized projection and datum, ensuring compatibility and ease of use. Moreover, the geohydrologic data is organized in a manner that simplifies analysis. This thoughtful structuring of data enhances accessibility and usability, making it a valuable resource for researchers and analysts.

accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
useconst: None. Users are advised to read the data set's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.

complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record for additional details.

distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data for other purposes, nor on all computer systems, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
